title: Teen dropped off by CISP van, then shot dead
content:
PITTSBURGH —
A teenager was gunned down in his neighborhood after attending a court-ordered afterschool program Monday night.
The medical examiner identified the victim as Dalon Williams, 17, of Garfield.
"I think it's kind of messed up," said neighbor James Shaw. "I got teenagers myself, a 16-year-old son. I just pray things get better."
Pittsburgh police said Williams was found shot on Mossfield Street around 9 p.m. after he was dropped off by a Community Intensive Supervision Program van.
"Shooting somebody don't make you a man or a woman. It makes you a coward," Shaw said.
Police haven't identified any suspects or a possible motive.
